<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># odds of default for each education group</span>
<span class="n">grad_def_odds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2036</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">8549</span>
<span class="n">univer_def_odds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3330</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">10700</span>
<span class="n">second_def_odds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1237</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">3680</span>
<span class="n">other_def_odds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">116</span>

<span class="c1"># Odds Ratios between groups</span>
<span class="n">grad_uni_OR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">grad_def_odds</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">univer_def_odds</span>
<span class="n">grad_second_OR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">grad_def_odds</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">second_def_odds</span>
<span class="n">grad_other_OR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">grad_def_odds</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">other_def_odds</span>
<span class="n">uni_second_OR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">univer_def_odds</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">second_def_odds</span>
<span class="n">uni_other_OR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">univer_def_odds</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">other_def_odds</span>
<span class="n">second_other_OR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">second_def_odds</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">other_def_odds</span>

<span class="c1"># SE for each OR</span>
<span class="n">SE_grad_uni</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">SE_grad_second</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">SE_grad_other</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">SE_uni_second</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">SE_uni_other</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">SE_second_other</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">edu_default</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iloc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>

<span class="c1"># 95% CI for each OR</span>
<span class="n">grad_uni_CI_Lower</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grad_uni_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_grad_uni</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">grad_uni_CI_Upper</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grad_uni_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_grad_uni</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Graduate and University OR CI:'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">grad_uni_CI_Lower</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">grad_uni_CI_Upper</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">grad_second_CI_Lower</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grad_second_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_grad_second</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">grad_second_CI_Upper</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grad_second_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_grad_second</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Graduate and Secondary OR CI:'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">grad_second_CI_Lower</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">grad_second_CI_Upper</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">grad_other_CI_Lower</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grad_other_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_grad_other</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">grad_other_CI_Upper</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grad_other_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_grad_other</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Graduate and Other OR CI:'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">grad_other_CI_Lower</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">grad_other_CI_Upper</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">uni_second_CI_Lower</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">uni_second_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_uni_second</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">uni_second_CI_Upper</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">uni_second_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_uni_second</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'University and Secondary OR CI:'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">uni_second_CI_Lower</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">uni_second_CI_Upper</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">uni_other_CI_Lower</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">uni_other_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_uni_other</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">uni_other_CI_Upper</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">uni_other_OR</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mf">1.96</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">SE_uni_other</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Odds-Ratio-Analysis">Odds Ratio Analysis<a class="anchor-link" href="#Odds-Ratio-Analysis">¶</a></h2><p>Besides the association between university and secondary educated customers, the odds ratio indicate that many of the compared groups have highly different rates of default, with the 'other' group having the smallest rate and the 'graduate' group having the lowest rate of all the educated groups. The difference in default rates between university and secondary is very slim, which may suggest that they can be grouped together for future analysis.</p>
<p>We have seen differnce that education makes in the likelihood of defaulting on a new payment. While the anlayis was informative, and could provide useful information in the feature engineering process, we still do not have a model that can predict whether a customer is probable to default in the next month or not.</p>
<h1 id="4.-Basic-Logistic-Regression-and-Evaluation">4. Basic Logistic Regression and Evaluation<a class="anchor-link" href="#4.-Basic-Logistic-Regression-and-Evaluation">¶</a></h1><p>I'll begin building a classification model of whether a customer will default on their next payment by building a base-line logistic regression model using default settings from sklearn. Once trained, I will test its accuracy, precision, and recall measurements. Recall will be the most important metric for this problem since the dataset is imbalanced, since most (about 78%) of the results are from the '0', non-default, class. Recall, or the true positive rate, will be the most important metric to adjust, since the damage done to credit card companies is most severe from not predicting customers who will default and the damage done by predicting a false positive is annoying to the customer, but much less severe in terms of consequences.</p>
<p>Now, to train a logistic regression model with default parameters.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">sklearn.model_selection</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">train_test_split</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">sklearn.linear_model</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">sklearn.metrics</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">accuracy_score</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">classification_report</span>

<span class="c1"># Create X and Y objects for clarity</span>
<span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">clf_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Y'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">Y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">clf_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Y</span>

<span class="c1"># Split the data into a training and test set - 25% is testing</span>
<span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytest</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">train_test_split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">test_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Ensuring (X_train, y_train) and (X_test, y_test) are correct</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Ensuring the training set matrices are of equal size: "</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Ensuring the testing set matrices are of equal size: "</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Ensuring the train_test_split sums to origninal Length: "</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="c1"># Check ratio of classes in the ytrain and ytest datasets</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in training set: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in testing set: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in original dataset: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Ensuring the training set matrices are of equal size:  True
Ensuring the testing set matrices are of equal size:  True
Ensuring the train_test_split sums to origninal Length:  True
Fraction of the amount of minority class in training set: 0.222
Fraction of the amount of minority class in testing set: 0.217
Fraction of the amount of minority class in original dataset: 0.221
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We have thoroughly ensured that the test_train_split returned the same fraction of the minority class as is in the parent dataset. Now, I will train a logistic regression model on the Xtrain and ytrain datasets, knowing that they are accurate.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Creating model</span>
<span class="n">clf</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">clf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Print the accuracy and recall from the testing data. Table values.</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Accuracy Score:'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">accuracy_score</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">target_names</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'1'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Accuracy Score: 0.78342780927
             precision    recall  f1-score   support

          0       0.78      1.00      0.88      4699
          1       0.00      0.00      0.00      1299

avg / total       0.61      0.78      0.69      5998

</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>/Users/vincent_zaballa/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/sklearn/metrics/classification.py:1135: UndefinedMetricWarning:

Precision and F-score are ill-defined and being set to 0.0 in labels with no predicted samples.

</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We could look at the accuracy and think that 78% is not terrible, a decent start, but reviewing recall shows a large discrepancy between precition of the non-default and default classes. What the default model did was train to maximize accuracy, and by predicting all of the 0-class correctly, it did pretty well to accomplish this goal. However, this completely misses the problem of predicting customers who will default, as is indicated by a recall score of 0 for the default class.</p>
<p>Before I move on to techniques to deal with imbalanced data, I'll try and tune the hyperparameters for both l1 and l2 logistic regression before moving on.</p>
<h2 id="5.-GridsearchCV-to-Optimize-L1-and-L2-Logistic-Regression-And-Evaluation">5. GridsearchCV to Optimize L1 and L2 Logistic Regression And Evaluation<a class="anchor-link" href="#5.-GridsearchCV-to-Optimize-L1-and-L2-Logistic-Regression-And-Evaluation">¶</a></h2><p>Will use GridsearchCV from sklearn to find the optimal values of the regularization parameter 'C', according to 'L1' and 'L2' norms. Sklearn's GridsearchCV is able to search for the optimal hyperparameters for both L1 and L2 logistic regression. My expectation is that L2 regression will work better than L1 regularization, as L1 typically works better for data that is sparse, which is not the case from our data, as indicated from the inferential statistics section performed on the data.</p>
<p>I will be optimizing the parameters against accuracy and recall, of which I expect each optimal value to be different.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">sklearn.model_selection</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>

<span class="n">scores</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'accuracy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'recall'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">clf1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="c1"># Do not change this.</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">score</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">scores</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l1 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l2 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre># Tuning hyper-parameters for l1 accuracy

LogisticRegression(C=0.85316785241728055, class_weight=None, dual=False,
          fit_intercept=True, intercept_scaling=1, max_iter=100,
          multi_class='ovr', n_jobs=1, penalty='l1', random_state=None,
          solver='liblinear', tol=0.0001, verbose=0, warm_start=False) 
 {'penalty': 'l1', 'C': 0.85316785241728055} 
 0.818909454727

# Tuning hyper-parameters for l2 accuracy

LogisticRegression(C=0.0001, class_weight=None, dual=False,
          fit_intercept=True, intercept_scaling=1, max_iter=100,
          multi_class='ovr', n_jobs=1, penalty='l2', random_state=None,
          solver='liblinear', tol=0.0001, verbose=0, warm_start=False) 
 {'penalty': 'l2', 'C': 0.0001} 
 0.777472069368
# Tuning hyper-parameters for l1 recall

LogisticRegression(C=0.52983169062837077, class_weight=None, dual=False,
          fit_intercept=True, intercept_scaling=1, max_iter=100,
          multi_class='ovr', n_jobs=1, penalty='l1', random_state=None,
          solver='liblinear', tol=0.0001, verbose=0, warm_start=False) 
 {'penalty': 'l1', 'C': 0.52983169062837077} 
 0.355631765857

# Tuning hyper-parameters for l2 recall

LogisticRegression(C=0.0001, class_weight=None, dual=False,
          fit_intercept=True, intercept_scaling=1, max_iter=100,
          multi_class='ovr', n_jobs=1, penalty='l2', random_state=None,
          solver='liblinear', tol=0.0001, verbose=0, warm_start=False) 
 {'penalty': 'l2', 'C': 0.0001} 
 0.0
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We now have the optimal gridsearchCV parameters. What are their respective recall scores?</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">clf_opt_recall_L1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.204335</span><span class="p">)</span> 
<span class="n">clf_opt_accuracy_L1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.85316</span><span class="p">)</span> 

<span class="n">clf_opt_recall_L2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.0001</span><span class="p">)</span> 
<span class="n">clf_opt_accuracy_L2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.0001</span><span class="p">)</span> 

<span class="c1">#Fitting the models</span>
<span class="n">clf_opt_recall_L1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_opt_recall_L2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">clf_opt_accuracy_L1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_opt_accuracy_L2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Optimized L1 precision-recall scores'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Optimized Recall'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_opt_recall_L1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Optimized Accuracy'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_opt_accuracy_L1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Optimized L2 precision-recall scores'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Optimized Recall'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_opt_recall_L2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Optimized Accuracy'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ytest</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_opt_accuracy_L2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtrain</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ytrain</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Xtest</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

avg / total       0.61      0.78      0.69      5998

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that, while there is a difference in the optimal values for accuracy and recall, the parameter values differ by less than a thousandth. The bigger difference here is between L1 and L2 regularization, of which, L1 performed much better than L2. Even when optimized for recall, L2 was not able to return a satisfactory result. This is not to say that L1 logistic regression returned a satisfactory result, as a recall of 0.34 for defaults can still be considered bad, but that it is much better than 0.</p>
<h1 id="6.-Resampling:-Oversampling-and-Undersampling-Methods-on-Logistic-Regression">6. Resampling: Oversampling and Undersampling Methods on Logistic Regression<a class="anchor-link" href="#6.-Resampling:-Oversampling-and-Undersampling-Methods-on-Logistic-Regression">¶</a></h1><p>There is an imbalance in the dataset that cannot be solved by simply optimizing the penalty parameters of L1-logistic regression. Instead, I will need to either under-sample or over-sample the dataset to balance the two. According to the rules of thumb listed below, I can choose from under-sampling or over-sampling to balance the dataset. I can do both and compare their Accuracy and precision-recall metric in order to determine which method improves the model the most. Additionally, I will experiment with random and non-random sampling schemes for over-sampling and under-sampling. From here on I will refer to the class with more elements as the "majority class" and the one with less as the "minority class".</p>
<p>Some Rules of Thumb:</p>
<ul>
<li><p>Consider under-sampling of the majority class when there is plenty of data (tens- or hundreds of thousands of instances or more)</p>
</li>
<li><p>Consider over-sampling of the minority class when you have a paucity of data (tens of thousands of records or less)</p>
</li>
<li><p>Consider random and non-random (e.g. stratified) sampling schemes.</p>
</li>
<li><p>Consider different resampling ratios (e.g. you don’t have to target a 1:1 ratio in a binary classification problem, try other ratios)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>I will oversample the minority class so both classes have the same size. I will use SMOTE, implemented by the imbalanced-learn package, which works as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li><p>Finding the k-nearest-neighbors for minority class observations (finding similar observations)</p>
</li>
<li><p>Randomly choosing one of the k-nearest-neighbors and using it to create a similar, but randomly tweaked, new observation.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Undersampling">Undersampling<a class="anchor-link" href="#Undersampling">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">imblearn.under_sampling</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">RandomUnderSampler</span>
<span class="c1"># Reminder: Xtrain, Xtest, ytrain, ytest</span>

<span class="c1"># Undersampling with imblearn</span>
<span class="n">rus</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">RandomUnderSampler</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">random_state</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ratio</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">X_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_us</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">rus</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit_sample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Creating training/testing split for undersampled dataset</span>
<span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X_test_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_test_us</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">train_test_split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">test_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                                <span class="n">stratify</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Y_us</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Check ratio of classes in the ytrain and ytest datasets</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in training set: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in testing set: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in original dataset: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Fraction of the amount of minority class in training set: 0.500
Fraction of the amount of minority class in testing set: 0.500
Fraction of the amount of minority class in original dataset: 0.221
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that the fraction of positive to negative outcomes is completely equal here. This was meant to verify that I properly under-sampled the dataset and preserved an equal ratio in the training and test datasets.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># GridsearchCV</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>

<span class="n">scores</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'accuracy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'recall'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># out of the box logistic regression</span>
<span class="n">clf_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">clf_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">score</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">scores</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l1 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="c1">#still using clf1 from first cell</span>
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l2 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Creating new models</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.32903</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">5.73615</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.001743</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">23.95027</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Fitting the models</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Summary of precision-recall metric for all models</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">Undersampled precision-recall metrics</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Precision-Recall Metrics of Non-Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Accuracy Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Recall Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Note:-Accuracy-and-Recall-Optimized-GridsearchCV">Note: Accuracy and Recall Optimized GridsearchCV<a class="anchor-link" href="#Note:-Accuracy-and-Recall-Optimized-GridsearchCV">¶</a></h3><p>As expected, there is a change in recall score when optimized for recall as opposed to accuracy. However, it's interesting to note that the recall-optimized L1 has a lower overall recall than accuracy-optimized L1 logistic regression. The recall would be higher for the recall-optimized L1 logistic regression, but it is not. Further investigation needs to be done with a graphical interpretation of the values. I will plot these on a precision-recall curve, later.</p>
<h2 id="Undersampling-Result-Interpretation">Undersampling Result Interpretation<a class="anchor-link" href="#Undersampling-Result-Interpretation">¶</a></h2><p>As mentioned, there was not a difference between optimizing for accuracy and recall. There was a large difference in recall between L1 and L2 optimized results. The L1 logistic regression has a better score for predicting the non-default class, whereas the L2 logistic regression is better at predicting for the default (Y=1) class. The default logistic regression algorithm didn't do too bad, but that's mainly because it is using L2 regularization under the hood and the optimal lambda value of C=1. I will leave out the default parameter from here on out, as I just wanted to show that it can return a decent accuracy or recall measurement.</p>
<h2 id="Oversampling">Oversampling<a class="anchor-link" href="#Oversampling">¶</a></h2><p>Now that we've seen some results for undersampling the majority class, let's take a look at oversampling the minority class. This time, I am just going to optimize the parameters on the 'recall' measurement and leave out the default logistic regression value.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">imblearn.over_sampling</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">SMOTE</span>
<span class="c1"># Smote oversampling</span>
<span class="n">sm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">SMOTE</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ratio</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># ratio = 1 means equal classes. This can be tweaked.</span>
<span class="n">X_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_os</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit_sample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Creating training/testing split for undersampled dataset</span>
<span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X_test_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_test_os</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">train_test_split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">test_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                                <span class="n">stratify</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Y_os</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Check ratio of classes in the ytrain and ytest datasets</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in training set: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in testing set: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_os</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">Y_test_os</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_os</span><span class="p">)))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Fraction of the amount of minority class in original dataset: </span><span class="si">%.3f</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Fraction of the amount of minority class in training set: 0.500
Fraction of the amount of minority class in testing set: 0.500
Fraction of the amount of minority class in original dataset: 0.221
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that the ratio of minority class to majority class is once again equalized here. Now to train a model with the oversampled dataset.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># GridsearchCV</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>

<span class="n">scores</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'accuracy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'recall'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">score</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">scores</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l1 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l2 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
